in its original koshirae.  
>> The heavy 32.75" blade is unsigned but inscr=
ibed =92ichi=92 as are the  
>> yamagane fuchi, koi-guchi and one seppa, th=
e open end of the tsuka  
>> is similarly marked in ink under the fuchi. Th=
e tsuba is 16th  
>> century Tachi-kanagushi work lacquered red and may be =
original to  
>> the mounting.
>>
>> The blade is too discoloured to see an=
y details but it has ububa of  
>> 7" and the edge side of the habaki has a=
 slot cut into it to allow  
>> for this.
>>
>> I assume this is the first =
of a group of similarly mounted weapons  
>> ordered by a clan or Temple. I=
 think that the sword has been kept  
>> in storage for a very long time as=
 it is not for everyday use,  
>> weighing around 6lbs and is 4'7" long ove=
rall and is in mostly good  
>> condition but with worm holes in the leathe=
r bound tsuka

imilarly
